Great builded voids, great crowded stillnesses put on, often, in the heart of cities, for the small hours, a sort of sinister mask, and it was of this large collective negation that Brydon presently became conscious--all the more that the break of day was, almost incredibly, now at hand, proving to him what night he had made of it.
author: Henry James, The Jolly Corner

quote: The city's all brightnessand shadow, deckle-edged, bluer than air-there's no help anywhere-you no longer know how to listen.
author: Ralph Angel

quote: ...the assessment of psychological drift, that is the way in which an undirected pedestrian tends to move about in a particular quarter of the town, tending to establish natural connections between places, the zones of influence of particular institutions and public services, and so forth. It may well be objected that these techniques are un-scientific, disorderly and too subjective, but the fact remains that the Situationists are studying the actual texture of towns and their relationship to human beings more intensively than most architects and in a more down-to-pavement manner than most town planners.
author: Tom McDonough, The Situationists and the City: A Reader

quote: 8. Conditions of DialogueThe functional is what is practical. The only practical thing is the resolution of our fundamental problem: the realization of ourselves (our uncoupling from the system of isolation). This is useful and utilitarian. Nothing else. All the rest represents only trivial derivations of the practical, and its mystification.
author: Tom McDonough, The Situationists and the City: A Reader

quote: We are leading as thorough a study of 'alienation's positive pole' as of its negative pole. As a consequence of our diagnosis of the poverty of wealth, we are able to establish the world map of the extreme wealth of poverty. These speaking maps of a new topography will be in fact the first realization of 'human geography.' On them we will replace oil-deposits with the contours of layers of untapped pedestrian consciousness.
author: Tom McDonough, The Situationists and the City: A Reader

quote: Although the world is full of suffering  it is full also of the overcoming of it.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Ambition can creep as well as soar.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: An expert is a man who has made all the mistakes  which can be made  in a very narrow field.
author: Niels Bohr

quote: An expert is someone who knows some of the worst mistakes that can be made in his subject and how to avoid them.
author: Werner Heisenberg

quote: Faith moves mountains  but you have to keep pushing while you are praying.
author: Mason Cooley

quote: Men achieve a certain greatness unawares  when working to another aim.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Nothing is too small to know  and nothing too big to attempt.
author: William Van Horne

quote: So there he is at last. Man on the moon. The poor  magnificent bungler! He can't even get to the office without undergoing the agonies of the damned  but give him a little metal  a few chemicals  some wire and 20 or 30 billion dollars and  vroom! There he is  up on a rock  a quarter of a million miles up in the sky.
author: Russell Baker

quote: The best is the enemy of the good.
author: Voltaire

quote: The difference between what we do and what we are capable of doing would suffice to solve most of the world's problems.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: The measure of a master is his success in bringing all men round to his opinion 20 years later.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The trouble with specialists is that they tend to think in grooves.
author: Elaine Morgan

quote: There are no credentials. They do not even need a medical certificate. They need not be sound either in body or mind. They only require a certificate of birth -just to prove they are first of the litter. You would not choose a Spaniel on these principles. (On aristocracy)
author: David Lloyd George

quote: Where I was born and where and how I have lived is unimportant. It is what I have done with where I have been that should be of interest.
author: Georgia O'Keeffe

quote: You commit a sin of omission if you do not utilize all the power that is within you. All men have claims on man  and to the man with special talents  this is a very special claim. It is required that a man take part in the actions and clashes of his time than the peril of being judged not to have lived at all.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: I am surprised nothing has been made of the fact that astronaut Neil Armstrong carried no sidearms when he landed on the moon.
author: Justice Arthur Goldberg

quote: 'What would you call the highest happiness?' Wratislaw was asked. 'The sense of competence ' was the answer  given without hesitation.
author: John Buchan

quote: The winds and waves are always on the side of the ablest navigators.
author: Edward Gibbon

quote: How many 'coming men' has one known? Where on earth do they all go to?
author: Arthur Wing Pinero

quote: He is the best sailor who can steer within fewest points of the wind  and exact a motive power out of the greatest obstacles.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: They are able who think they are able.
author: Virgil

quote: The biggest things are always the easiest to do because there is no competition.
author: William Van Home

quote: What we do upon some great occasion will probably depend on what we already are: and what we are will be the result of previous years of self-discipline.
author: H. P. Liddon

quote: It's pretty hard to be efficient without being obnoxious.
author: Kin Hubbard

quote: Nothing great is created suddenly  any more than a bunch of grapes or a fig. If you tell me that you desire a fig  I answer you that there must be time. Let it first blossom  then bear fruit  then ripen.
author: Epictetus

quote: Out of the strain of the Doing  Into the peace of the Done.
author: Julia Louise Woodruff

quote: It's them that takes advantage that gets advantage i' this world.
author: George Eliot

quote: Anything you're good at contributes to happiness.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: I think knowing what you cannot do is more important than knowing what you can do.
author: Lucille Ball

quote: There is endless merit in a man's knowing when to have done.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: It's the whole  not the detail  that matters.
author: German proverb

quote: Long is the road from conception to completion.
author: Moliere

quote: Only those who dare to fail greatly can ever achieve greatly.
author: Robert F. Kennedy

quote: Back of every achievement is a proud wife and a surprised mother-in-law.
author: Brooks Hays

quote: Noise proves nothing. Often a hen who has merely laid an egg cackles as if she had laid an asteroid.
author: Mark Twain

quote: We judge ourselves by what we feel capable of doing  while others judge us by what we have already done.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Do what you can  with what you have  where you are.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: About all some men accomplish in life is to send a son to Harvard.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: He has half the deed done who has made a beginning.
author: Horace

quote: Give me where to stand  and I will move the earth.
author: Archimedes

quote: The only way round is through.
author: Robert Frost

quote: If a man does not keep pace with his companions  perhaps it is because he hears a different drummer. Let him step to the music which he hears  however measured or far away.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Is there anything in life so disenchanting as attainment?
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: I'm a slow walker  but I never walk back.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: That's one small step for a man  one giant leap for mankind.
author: Neil Armstrong

quote: You cannot fly like an eagle with the wings of a wren.
author: William Henry Hudson

quote: In esse I am nothing  in posse I am everything.
author: John Adams

quote: Out of the best and most productive years of each man's life  he should carve a segment in which he puts his private career aside to serve his community and his country  and thereby serve his children  his neighbours  his fellow men  and the cause of freedom.
author: David Lilienthal

quote: Good is not good  where better is expected.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Never look down to test the ground before taking your next step  only he who keeps his eye fixed on the far horizon will find his right road.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

quote: We promise according to our hopes  and perform according to our fears.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: Practice yourself  for heaven's sake  in little things  and thence proceed to greater.
author: Epictetus

quote: For a man to achieve all that is demanded of him he must regard himself as greater than he is.
author: Goethe

quote: He that leaveth nothing to Chance will do few things ill  but he will do very few things.
author: George, Lord Halifax

quote: When spider webs unite  they can tie up a lion.
author: Ethiopian proverb

quote: Everyone must row with the oars he has.
author: English proverb

quote: Every calling is great when greatly pursued.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Any jackass can kick down a barn  but it takes a good carpenter to build one.
author: Sam Rayburn

quote: God gives the nuts  but he does not crack them.
author: German proverb

quote: Let me tell you the secret that has led me to my goal. My strength lies solely in my tenacity.
author: Louis Pasteur

quote: What one has to do usually can be done.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: The world is all gates  all opportunities  strings of tension waiting to be struck.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: I confess that altruistic and cynically selfish talk seem to me about equally unreal. With all humility  I think 'whatsoever thy hand findeth to do  do it with thy might ' infinitely more important than the vain attempt to love one's neighbour as one's self. If you want to hit a bird on the wing you must have all your will in focus  you must not be thinking about yourself  and equally  you must not be thinking about your neighbour  you must be living with your eye on that bird. Every achievement is a bird on the wing.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Sometimes it is more important to discover what one cannot do  than what one can do.
author: Lin Yutang

quote: To achieve great things  we must live as though we were never going to die.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: I am easily satisfied with the very best.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: The more we realize our minuteness and our impotence in the face of cosmic forces  the more astonishing becomes what human beings have achieved.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Don't be afraid to take a big step if one is indicated. You can't cross a chasm in two small jumps.
author: David Lloyd George

quote: There is nothing so useless as doing efficiently that which should not be done at all.
author: Peter F. Drucker

quote: Each morning sees some task begun Each evening sees it close. Something attempted  something done  Has earned a night's repose.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: The reward of a thing well done  is to have done it.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: God will not look you over for medals  degrees or diplomas  but for scars.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: There are two kinds of people: those who are always well and those who are always sick. Most of the evils of the world come from the first sort and most of the achievements from the second.
author: Louis Dudek

quote: Behind an able man there are always other able men.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: As we advance in life  we learn the limits of our abilities.
author: James Froude

quote: We judge ourselves by what we feel capable of doing  while others judge us by what we have already done.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Ability is of little account without opportunity.
author: Napoleon

quote: They are able because they think they are able.
author: Virgil

quote: Greater things are believed of those who are absent.
author: Tacitus

quote: Absences are a good influence in love and keep it bright and delicate.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: The longest absence is less perilous to love than the terrible trials of incessant proximity.
author: Ouida

quote: Failing to be there when a man wants her is a woman's greatest sin  except to be there when he doesn't want her.
author: Helen Rowland

quote: Absence diminishes little passions and increases great ones just as the wind blows out a candle and fans a fire.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: It takes time for the absent to assume their true shape in our thoughts. After death they take on a firmer outline and then cease to change.
author: Colette

quote: Sometimes  when one person is missing  the whole world seems depopulated.
author: Alphonse de Lamartine

quote: The absent are always wrong.
author: English proverb

quote: Absence makes the heart grow fonder.
author: Thomas Haynes Bayly

quote: Absent in body  but present in spirit.
author: Bible

quote: Achilles absent  was Achilles still.
author: Homer

quote: Let no one be willing to speak ill of the absent.
author: Propertius

quote: Some people confuse acceptance with apathy  but there's all the difference in the world. Apathy fails to distinguish between what can and what cannot be helped  acceptance makes that distinction. Apathy paralyzes the will-to-action  acceptance frees it by relieving it of impossible burdens.
author: Arthur Gordon

quote: Acceptance says  "True  this is my situation at the moment. I'll look unblinkingly at the reality of it. But I'll also open my hands to accept willingly whatever a loving Father sends me."
author: Catharine Marshall

quote: It's not a very big step from contentment to complacency.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: The minute you settle for less than you deserve  you get even less than you settled for.
author: Maureen Dowd

quote: "Good enough never is" has become the motto of this company.
author: Debbi Fields

quote: God  grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change  the courage to change the things I can  and the wisdom to know the difference.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quote: We must accept finite disappointment  but we must never lose infinite hope.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Acceptance is not submission  it is acknowledgement of the facts of a situation. Then deciding what you're going to do about it.
author: Kathleen Casey Theisen

quote: Self-complacency is fatal to progress.
author: Margaret Elizabeth Sangster

quote: You have to take it as it happens  but you should try to make it happen the way you want to take it.
author: Old German proverb

quote: Never deny a diagnosis  but do deny the negative verdict that may go with it.
author: Norman Cousins

quote: All that is necessary is to accept the impossible  do without the indispensable  and bear the intolerable.
author: Kathleen Norris

quote: The happy and efficient people in this world are those who accept trouble as a normal detail of human life and resolve to capitalize it when it comes along.
author: H. Bertram Lewis

quote: For those who live neither with religious consolations about death nor with a sense of death (or of anything else) as natural  death is the obscene mystery  the ultimate affront  the thing that cannot be controlled. It can only be denied.
author: Susan Sontag

quote: Who except the gods can live without any pain?
author: Aeschylus

quote: Misfortune comes to all men.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: The real world is not easy to live in. It is rough  it is slippery. Without the most clear-eyed adjustments we fall and get crushed.
author: Clarence Day

quote: Life has no smooth road for any of us  and in the bracing atmosphere of a high aim the very roughness stimulates the climber to steadier steps 'til the legend  "over steep ways to the stars " fulfills self.
author: W. C. Doane

quote: Maturity is achieved when a person accepts life as full of tension.
author: Joshua L. Liebman

quote: Yet man is born unto trouble  as the sparks fly upward.
author: Bible

quote: Into each life some rain must fall  some days must be dark and dreary.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: There is no man in this world without some manner of tribulation or anguish  though he be king or pope.
author: Thomas a Kempis

quote: There is no armor against fate  death lays his icy hands on kings.
author: James Shirley

quote: There is no easy path leading out of life  and few are the easy ones that lie within it.
author: Walter Savage Landor

quote: A man shares his days with hunger  thirst  and cold  with the good times and the bad  and the first part of being a man is to understand that.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: It is arrogance to expect that life will always be music.... Harmony  like a following breeze at sea  is the exception. In a world where most things wind up broken or lost  our lot is to tack and tune.
author: Harvey Oxenhorn

quote: One cannot get through life without pain. ... What we can do is choose how to use the pain life presents to us.
author: Bernie S. Siegel

quote: The mass of men lead lives of quiet desperation.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: If you have arthritis  calmly say  I was always complaining about the ruts in the road until I realized that the ruts are the road.
author: Anonymous

quote: "Okay  I have arthritis  and this is the way arthritis is." Take pain as it comes and you can better master it.
author: Charles Clifford Peale

quote: It is right it should be so  Man was made for joy and woe  And when this we rightly know  Through the world we safely go.
author: William Blake

quote: Anyone who proposes to do good must not expect people to roll stones out of his way  but must accept his lot calmly  even if they roll a few more upon it.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: Free man is by necessity insecure  thinking man by necessity uncertain.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: You have come into a hard world. I know of only one easy place in it  and that is the grave.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Against necessity  against its strength  no one can fight and win.
author: Aeschylus

quote: A wise man never refuses anything to necessity.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: When necessity speaks  it demands.
author: Russian proverb

quote: How base a thing it is when a man will struggle with necessity! We have to die.
author: Euripides

quote: Whatever is-is best.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quote: Anything in life that we don't accept will simply make trouble for us until we make peace with it.
author: Shakti Gawain

quote: The reasonable man adapts himself to the world  the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Much sheer effort goes into avoiding the truth  left to itself  it sweeps in like the tide.
author: Fay Weldon

quote: We win half the battle when we make up our minds to take the world as we find it  including the thorns.
author: Orison Swett Marden

quote: A man must live in the world and make the best of it  such as it is.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: There are some people that you cannot change  you must either swallow them whole or leave them alone.
author: Margot Asquith

quote: The world is not to be put in order  the world is order incarnate. It is for us to put ourselves in unison with this order.
author: Henry Miller

quote: God asks no man whether he will accept life. This is not the choice. You must take it. The only question is how.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: There is no cure for birth or death save to enjoy the interval.
author: George Santayana

quote: No man can have society upon his own terms.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The most popular persons are those who take the world as it is  who find the least fault.
author: Charles Dudley Warner

quote: If you bear the cross unwillingly  you make it a burden  and load yourself more heavily  but you must bear it.
author: Thomas a Kempis

quote: There are two ways of meeting difficulties: you alter the difficulties  or you alter yourself to meet them.
author: Phyllis Bottome

quote: I find that it is not the circumstances in which we are placed  but the spirit in which we face them  that constitutes our comfort.
author: Elizabeth T. King

quote: It is almost more important how a person takes his fate than what it is.
author: Wilhelm von Humboldt

quote: The individual who is best prepared for any occupation is the one ... able to adapt himself to any situation.
author: Mortimer Smith

quote: To act with common sense  according to the moment  is the best wisdom  and the best philosophy is to do one's duties  to take the world as it comes  submit respectfully to one's lot  and bless the goodness that has given us so much happiness with it  whatever it is.
author: Horace Walpole

quote: The art of life lies in a constant readjustment to our surroundings.
author: Okakura Kakuzo

quote: To repel one's cross is to make it heavier.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: Ask not that events should happen as you will  but let your will be that events should happen as they do  and you shall have peace.
author: Epictetus

quote: The survival of the fittest is the ageless law of nature  but the fittest are rarely the strong. The fittest are those endowed with the qualifications for adaptation  the ability to accept the inevitable and conform to the unavoidable  to harmonize with existing or changing conditions.
author: Dave E. Smalley

quote: The ideal man bears the accidents of life with dignity and grace  making the best of circumstances.
author: Aristotle

quote: He is happy whose circumstances suit his temper  but he is more excellent who can suit his temper to any circumstances.
author: David Hume

quote: Life is 10 percent what you make it  and 90 percent how you take it.
author: Irving Berlin

quote: A mountain man tries to live with the country instead of against it.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: Vex not thy spirit at the course of things  they heed not thy vexation. How ludicrous and outlandish is astonishment at anything that may happen in life.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: If you can't fight  and you can't flee  flow.
author: Robert Eliot

quote: Today I know that I cannot control the ocean tides. I can only go with the flow.... When I struggle and try to organize the Atlantic to my specifications  I sink. If I flail and thrash and growl and grumble  I go under. But if I let go and float  I am borne aloft.
author: Marie Stilkind

quote: One learns to adapt to the land in which one lives.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: She had believed the land was her enemy  and she struggled against it  but you could not make war against a land any more than you could against the sea. One had to learn to live with it  to belong to it  to fit into its seasons and its ways.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: Flow with whatever may happen and let your mind be free. Stay centered by accepting whatever you are doing. This is the ultimate.
author: Chuang-tzu

quote: When you have got an elephant by the hind legs and he is trying to run away  it is best to let him run.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Learn to drink the cup of life as it comes.
author: Agnes Turnbull

quote: Arrange whatever pieces come your way.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Everything in life that we really accept undergoes a change. So suffering must become love. That is the mystery.
author: Katherine Mansfield

quote: You can't fight the desert... you have to ride with it.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: All I can do is play the game the way the cards fall.
author: James A. Michener

quote: Don't be sad  don't be angry  if life deceives you! Submit to your grief  your time for joy will come  believe me.
author: Aleksandr Pushkin

quote: When we see ourselves in a situation which must be endured and gone through  it is best to meet it with firmness  and accommodate everything to it in the best way practicable. This lessens the evil  while fretting and fuming only increase your own torments.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Always fall in with what you're asked to accept.... My aim in life has always been to hold my own with whatever's going. Not against: with.
author: Robert Frost

quote: There is no quality of human nature so nearly royal as the ability to yield gracefully.
author: Charles Conrad

quote: The best thing we can do is to make wherever we're lost look as much like home as we can.
author: Christopher Fry

quote: Make a virtue of necessity.
author: Geoffrey Chaucer

quote: Cooperation is doing with a smile what you have to do anyhow.
author: Anonymous

quote: We must make the best of those ills which cannot be avoided.
author: Alexander Hamilton

quote: For so must it be  and help me do my part.
author: Anonymous

quote: There are no conditions to which a man cannot become accustomed.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A private railroad car is not an acquired taste. One takes to it immediately.
author: Eleanor R. Belmont

quote: Man adapts himself to everything  to the best and the worst.
author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

quote: Being unready and ill-equipped is what you have to expect in life. It is the universal predicament. It is your lot as a human being to lack what it takes. Circumstances are seldom right. You never have the capacities  the strength  the wisdom  the virtue you ought to have. You must always do with less than you need in a situation vastly different from what you would have chosen as appropriate for your special endowments.
author: Charlton Ogburn

quote: In the face of an obstacle which is impossible to overcome  stubbornness is stupid.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: Very few live by choice. Every man is placed in his present condition by causes which acted without his foresight  and with which he did not always willingly cooperate  and therefore you will rarely meet one who does not think the lot of his neighbor better than his own.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: To exist is to adapt  and if one could not adapt  one died and made room for those who could.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: Happy the man who early learns the wide chasm that lies between his wishes and his powers.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: Real life is  to most men ... a perpetual compromise between the ideal and the possible.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: People are lucky and unlucky ... according to the ratio between what they get and what they have been led to expect.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: He who cannot do what he wants must make do with what he can.
author: Terence

quote: What has always made a hell on earth has been that man has tried to make it his heaven.
author: Friedrich Holderlin

quote: Good is not good  where better is expected.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Nobody has things just as he would like them. The thing to do is to make a success with what material I have. It is a sheer waste of time and soul-power to imagine what I would do if things were different. They are not different.
author: Dr. Frank Crane

quote: We must like what we have when we don't have what we like.
author: Roger de Rabutin

quote: Better is the enemy of the good.
author: Voltaire

quote: If you aspire to the highest place  it is no disgrace to stop at the second  or even the third  place.
author: Cicero

quote: Genius does what it must  talent does what it can.
author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

quote: Nature is what you may do. There is much you may not do.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Results are what you expect  consequences are what you get.
author: Anonymous

quote: To expect life to be tailored to our specifications is to invite frustration.
author: Anonymous

quote: The resistance to the unpleasant situation is the root of suffering.
author: Ram Dass

quote: The chief pang of most trials is not so much the actual suffering itself as our own spirit of resistance to it.
author: Jean Nicholas Grou

quote: Each of us does  in effect  strike a series of "deals" or compromises between the wants and longings of the inner self  and an outer environment that offers certain possibilities and sets certain limitations.
author: Maggie Scarf

quote: Man is the only animal that laughs and weeps  for he is the only animal that is struck with the difference between what things are and what they might have been.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Every creator painfully experiences the chasm between his inner vision and its ultimate expression. The chasm is never completely bridged. We all have the conviction  perhaps illusory  that we have much more to say than appears on the paper.
author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

quote: The greatest and most important problems in life are all in a certain sense insoluble. They can never be solved  but only outgrown.
author: Carl Jung

quote: We do not write as we want  but as we can.
author: W Somerset Maugham

quote: The art of living lies less in eliminating our troubles than in growing with them.
author: Bernard M. Baruch

quote: A body shouldn't heed what might be. He's got to do with what is.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: The greatest evil which fortune can inflict on men is to endow them with small talents and great ambitions.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: We may fail of our happiness  strive we ever so bravely  but we are less likely to fail if we measure with judgment our chances and our capabilities.
author: Agnes Repplier

quote: I One of the signs of maturity is a healthy respect for reality-a respect that manifests itself in the level of one's aspirations and in the accuracy of one's assessment of the difficulties which separate the facts of today from the bright hopes of tomorrow.
author: Robert H. Davies

quote: Is life so wretched? Isn't it rather your hands which are too small  your vision which is muddled? You are the one who must grow up.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

quote: Nothing you write  if you hope to be any good  will ever come out as you first hoped.
author: Lillian Hellman

quote: Unhappiness is best defined as the difference between our talents and our expectations.
author: Dr. Edward De Bono

quote: Anxiety is that range of distress which attends willing what cannot be willed.
author: Leslie H. Farber

quote: There is a mortal breed most full of futility. In contempt of what is at hand  they strain into the future  hunting impossibilities on the wings of ineffectual hopes.
author: Pindar

quote: A life of frustration is inevitable for any coach whose man enjoyment is winning.
author: Chuck Noll

quote: No traveler e'er reached that blest abode who found not thorns and briers in his road.
author: William Cowper

quote: The trouble with most people is that they think with their hopes or fears or wishes rather than with their minds.
author: Will Durant

quote: It is a common observation that those who dwell continually upon their expectations are apt to become oblivious to the requirements of their actual situation.
author: Charles Sanders Peirce

quote: A hero is a man who does what he can.
author: Romain Rolland

quote: Life's under no obligation to give us what we expect.
author: Margaret Mitchell

quote: Buddha's doctrine: Man suffers because of his craving to possess and keep forever things which are essentially impermanent... this frustration of the desire to possess is the immediate cause of suffering.
author: Alan Watts

quote: The point... is to dwell upon the brightest parts in every prospect  to call off the thoughts when turning upon disagreeable objects  and strive to be pleased with the present circumstances.
author: Abraham Tucker

quote: Everything has its wonders  even darkness and silence  and I learn  whatever state I may be in  therein to be content.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Life is not always what one wants it to be  but to make the best of it  as it is  is the only way of being happy.
author: Jennie Jerome Churchill

quote: The English know how to make the best of things. Their so-called muddling through is simply skill at dealing with the inevitable.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: I make the most of all that comes and the least of all that goes.
author: Sara Teasdale

quote: We cannot conquer fate and necessity  yet we can yield to them in such a manner as to be greater than if we could.
author: Walter Savage Landor

quote: The idea came to me that I was  am  and will be  but perhaps will not become. This did not scare me. There was for me in being an intensity I did not feel in becoming.
author: Nina Berberova

quote: Here is a rule to remember when anything tempts you to feel bitter: not  "This is a misfortune " but "To bear this worthily is good fortune."
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: There is no good in arguing with the inevitable. The only argument available with an east wind is to put on your overcoat.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: Trouble will come soon enough  and when he does come receive him as pleasantly as possible ... the more amiably you greet him  the sooner he will go away.
author: Artemus Ward

quote: Adapt yourself to the things among which your lot has been cast and love sincerely the fellow creatures with whom destiny has ordained that you shall live.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: When we accept tough jobs as a challenge to our ability and wade into them with joy and enthusiasm  miracles can happen.
author: Arland Gilbert

quote: Love only what befalls you and is spun for you by fate.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: What you can't get out of  get into wholeheartedly.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quote: Let us train our minds to desire what the situation demands.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Ride the horse in the direction that it's going.
author: Werner Erhard

quote: If one has to submit  it is wasteful not to do so with the best grace possible.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Since God has been pleased to give us the Papacy  let us enjoy it.
author: Pope Leo X

quote: It is no use to grumble and complain  It's just as cheap and easy to rejoice  When God sorts out the weather and sends rain-Why  rain's my choice.
author: James Whitcomb Riley

quote: When a dog runs at you  whistle for him.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: An oak and a reed were arguing about their strength. When a strong wind came up  the reed avoided being uprooted by bending and leaning with the gusts of wind. But the oak stood firm and was torn up by the roots.
author: Aesop

quote: The grass must bend when the wind blows across it.
author: Confucius

quote: He who attempts to resist the wave is swept away  but he who bends before it abides.
author: Bible

quote: Adapt or perish  now as ever  is nature's inexorable imperative.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: One does not have to stand again the gale. One yields and becomes part of the wind.
author: Emmanuel

quote: I like trees because they seem more resigned to the way they have to live than other things do.
author: Willa Cather

quote: Nature magically suits a man to his fortunes  by making them the fruit of his character.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Better bend than break.
author: Scottish proverb

quote: The secret of success is to be in harmony with existence  to be always calm ... to let each wave of life wash us a little farther up the shore.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: There is only one way to happiness  and that is to cease worrying about things which are beyond the power of our will.
author: Epictetus

quote: The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it emotionally.
author: Flannery O'Connor

quote: Happiness ... can exist only in acceptance.
author: Denis De Rougemont

quote: Happiness comes from within a man  from some curious adjustment to life.
author: Hugh Walpole

quote: Happy he who learns to bear what he cannot change!
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: Contentment  and indeed usefulness  comes as the infallible result of great acceptances  great humilities-of not trying to conform to some dramatized version of ourselves.
author: David Grayson

quote: My advice to you is not to inquire why or whither  but just enjoy your ice cream while it's on your plate.
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: It is not necessarily those lands which are the most fertile or most favored in climate that seem to me the happiest  but those in which a long struggle of adaptation between man and his environment has brought out the best qualities of both.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: Life is not always what one wants it to be  but to make the best of it  as it is  is the only way of being happy.
author: Jennie Jerome Churchill

quote: Everything has its wonders  even darkness and silence  and I learn  whatever state I may be in  therein to be content.
author: Helen Keller

quote: I accept life unconditionally. ... Most people ask for happiness on condition. Happiness can only be felt if you don't set any condition.
author: Arthur Rubinstein

quote: Happiness is a function of accepting what is.
author: Werner Erhard

quote: One's first step in wisdom is to question everything  one's last is to come to terms with everything.
author: Georg Christoph Lichtenberg

quote: If you are wise  live as you can  if you cannot  live as you would.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: Wisdom never kicks at the iron walls it can't bring down.
author: Olive Schreiner

quote: For this is wisdom: to live  to take what fate  or the Gods  may give.
author: Laurence Hope

quote: Acceptance and Work If you have a job without aggravations  you don't have a job.
author: Malcolm Forbes

quote: When I decided to go into politics I weighed the costs. I would get criticism. But I went ahead. So when virulent criticism came I wasn't surprised. I was better able to handle it.
author: Herbert Hoover

quote: Every job has drudgery. ... The first secret of happiness is the recognition of this fundamental fact.
author: M. C. Mcintosh

quote: The fishermen know that the sea is dangerous and the storm terrible  but they have never found these dangers sufficient reason for remaining ashore.
author: Vincent van Gogh

quote: He who doesn't accept the conditions of life sells his soul.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: Greatness of soul consists not so much in soaring high and in pressing forward  as in knowing how to adapt and limit oneself.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: The beauty of the soul shines out when a man bears with composure one heavy mischance after another  not because he does not feel them  but because he is a man of high and heroic temper.
author: Aristotle

quote: The great soul surrenders itself to fate.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: The mind which renounces  once and forever  a futile hope  has its compensations in ever-growing calm.
author: George R. Gissing

quote: I not only bow to the inevitable  I am fortified by it.
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: I have accepted all and I am free. The inner chains are broken  as well as those outside.
author: C. F. Ramuz

quote: The most beautiful thing is inevitability of events  and the most ugly thing is trying to resist inevitability.
author: Katharine Butler Hathaway

quote: Peace of mind is that mental condition in which you have accepted the worst.
author: Lin Yutang

quote: If we can recognize that change and uncertainty are basic principles  we can greet the future and the transformation we are undergoing with the understanding that we do not know enough to be pessimistic.
author: Hazel Henderson

quote: We cannot change anything unless we accept it.
author: Carl Jung

quote: Acceptance of what has happened is the first step to overcoming the consequence of any misfortune.
author: William James

quote: Almost any event will put on a new face when received with cheerful acceptance.
author: Henry S. Haskins

quote: What it is forbidden to be put right becomes lighter by acceptance.
author: Horace

quote: One completely overcomes only what one assimilates.
author: Andre Gide

quote: If you cast away one cross  you will certainly find another  and perhaps a heavier.
author: Thomas a Kempis

quote: To repel one's cross is to make it heavier.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: Science says: "We must live " and seeks the means of prolonging  increasing  facilitating and amplifying life  of making it tolerable and acceptable  wisdom says: "We must die " and seeks how to make us die well.
author: Miguel de Unamuno

quote: True freedom lies in the realization and calm acceptance of the fact that there may very well be no perfect answer.
author: Allen Reid McGinnis

quote: As the soft yield of water cleaves obstinate stone  So to yield with life solves the insolvable: To yield  I have learned  is to come back again.
author: Lao-Tzu

quote: Things turn out best for people who make the best of the way things turn out.
author: Anonymous

quote: And acceptance is the answer to all my problems today. ... I can find no serenity until I accept that person  place  thing  or situation as being exactly the way it is supposed to be at this moment.
author: Alcoholics Anonymous

quote: Resistance causes pain and lethargy. It is when we practice acceptance that new possibilities appear.
author: Anonymous

quote: To oppose something is to maintain it.
author: Ursula K. LeGuin

quote: No life is so hard that you can't make it easier by the way you take it.
author: Ellen Glasgow

quote: Anything in life that we don't accept will simply make trouble for us until we make peace with it.
author: Shakti Gawain

quote: Often the prudent  far from making their destinies  succumb to them.
author: Voltaire

quote: Things past redress are now with me past care.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: What we call reality is an agreement that people have arrived at to make life more livable.
author: Louise Nevelson

quote: He who has calmly reconciled his life to fate ... can look fortune in the face.
author: Boethius

quote: No rose without a thorn.
author: French proverb

quote: Life leaps like a geyser for those who drill through the rock of inertia.
author: Dr. Alexis Carrel

quote: If you want a place in the sun  you've got to put up with a few blisters.
author: Abigail Van Buren

quote: Those who aim at great deeds must also suffer greatly.
author: Plutarch

quote: Nature  to be commanded  must be obeyed.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: The first step toward change is acceptance. Once you accept yourself  you open the door to change. That's all you have to do. Change is not something you do  it's something you allow.
author: Will Garcia

quote: Keep doing what you're doing and you'll keep getting what you're getting.
author: Anonymous

quote: Everything in life that we really accept undergoes a change. So suffering must become love. That is the mystery.
author: Katherine Mansfield

quote: We cannot change anything unless we accept it. Condemnation does not liberate  it oppresses.
author: Carl Jung

quote: When you make your peace with authority  you become authority.
author: Jim Morrison

quote: Ours must be the first age whose great goal  on a nonmaterial plane  is not fulfillment but adjustment.
author: Louis Kronenberger

quote: Woman must not accept  she must challenge.
author: Margaret Sanger

quote: We have fought this fight as long  and as well  as we know how. We have been defeated. There is now but one course to pursue. We must accept the situation.
author: Robert E. Lee

quote: Competition is about passion for perfection  and passion for other people who join in this impossible quest.
author: Mariah Burton Nelson

quote: Better to accept whatever happens.
author: Horace

quote: If we cannot do what we will  we must will what we can.
author: Yiddish proverb

quote: Every man must be content with that glory which he may have at home.
author: Boethius

quote: Every new adjustment is a crisis in self-esteem.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: What cannot be avoided  t'were childish weakness to lament or fear.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: I will not meddle with that which I cannot mend.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: I have learned to live with it all... whatever happens ... all of it.
author: Edelgard

quote: There is no such thing as pure pleasure  some anxiety always goes with it.
author: Ovid

quote: If a ship has been sunk  I can't bring it up. If it is going to be sunk  I can't stop it. I can use my time much better working on tomorrow's problem than by fretting about yesterday's. Besides  if I let those things get me  I wouldn't last long.
author: Admiral Ernest J. King

quote: One of the many lessons that one learns in prison is that things are what they are and will be what they will be.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Part of the happiness of life consists not in fighting battles  but in avoiding them. A masterly retreat is in itself a victory.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

quote: A flower falls even though we love it. A weed grows even though we don't love it.
author: Dogen

quote: Acceptance says  True  this is my situation at the moment. I'll look unblink-ingly at the reality of it. But I'll also open my hands to accept willingly whatever a loving Father sends me.
author: Catharine Marshall

quote: Man is a pliant animal  a being who gets accustomed to anything.
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

quote: The unknown is what it is. And to be frightened of it is what sends everybody scurrying around chasing dreams  illusions  wars  peace  love  hate  all that. Unknown is what it is. Accept that it's unknown  and it's plain sailing.
author: John Lennon

quote: Happiness is experienced when your life gives you what you are willing to accept.
author: Ken Keyes

quote: Acceptance is the truest kinship with humanity.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: What must be shall be  and that which is a necessity to him that struggles  is little more than choice to him that is willing.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Acceptance makes any event put on a new face.
author: Henry S. Haskins

quote: There is no sense in the struggle  but there is no choice but to struggle.
author: Ernie Pyle

quote: Boys  this is only a game. But it's like life in that you will be dealt some bad hands. Take each hand  good or bad  and don't whine and complain  but play it out. If you're men enough to do that  God will help and you will come out well.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower's mother

quote: Practice easing your way along. Don't get het up or in a dither. Do your best  take it as it comes. You can handle anything if you think you can. Just keep your cool and your sense of humor.
author: Smiley Blanton

quote: Accept that all of us can be hurt  that all of us can-and surely will at times-fail. Other vulnerabilities  like being embarrassed or risking love  can be terrifying too. I think we should follow a simple rule: if we can take the worst  take the risk.
author: Dr. Joyce Brothers

quote: Do not weep  do not wax indignant. Understand.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: We must learn to accept life and to accept ourselves ... with a shrug and a smile ... because it's all we've got.
author: Harvey Mindess

quote: I have accepted fear as a part of life -specifically the fear of change ... I have gone ahead despite the pounding in the heart that says: turn back. ...
author: Erica Jong

quote: There are things I can't force. I must adjust.
author: CM. Ward

quote: Let a man accept his destiny. No pity and no tears.
author: Euripides

quote: Wood may remain ten years in the water  but it will never become a crocodile.
author: Congolese proverb

quote: No matter how much you feed a wolf  he will always return to the forest.
author: Russian proverb

quote: Can the Ethiopian change his skin  or the leopard his spots?
author: Bible

quote: A wise man knows everything  a shrewd one  everybody.
author: Anonymous

quote: Sudden acquaintance brings repentance.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: If a man is worth knowing at all  he is worth knowing well.
author: Alexander Smith

quote: A good drama critic is one who perceives what is happening in the theatre of his time. A great drama critic also perceives what is not happening.
author: Kenneth Tynan

quote: A walking shadow  a poor player  that struts and frets his hour upon the stage and then is heard no more.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Acting is a question of absorbing other people's personalities and adding some of your own experience.
author: Paul Newman

quote: An actor is a guy who  if you ain't talking about him ain't listening.
author: George Glass

quote: An agent is a guy who is sore because an actor gets 90% of what he makes.
author: Alva Johnston

quote: Bugs Bunny - the perfect employee. Never absent. Never late. Never changes the script. Doesn't have an agent. Never asks for a percent of the profit. Doesn't ask to have his relatives on the payroll.
author: Anonymous

quote: In music  the punctuation is absolutely strict  the bars and the rests are absolutely defined. But our punctuation cannot be quite strict because we have to relate it to the audience. In other words  we are continually changing the score.
author: Ralph Richardson

quote: No form of art goes beyond ordinary consciousness as film does  straight to our emotions  deep into the twilight room of the soul.
author: Ingmar Bergman

quote: She was good at playing abstract confusion in the same way that a midget is good at being short.
author: Clive James

quote: The best audience is intelligent  well-educated  and a little drunk.
author: Alvin Barkley

quote: The play was a great success  but the audience was a disaster.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: The structure of a play is always the story of how the birds come home to roost.
author: Arthur Miller

quote: When the characters are really alive before their author  the latter does nothing but follow them in their action  in their words  in the situations which they suggest to him.
author: Luigi Pirandello

quote: Working in the theatre has a lot in common with unemployment.
author: Arthur Gingold

quote: There are some great roles - mostly in Shakespeare's tragedies which no one can play at full strength from beginning to end. One simply hopes that one can hit the peaks as often as one has the strength.
author: Peggy Ashcroft

quote: Acting is not being emotional  but being able to express emotion.
author: Kate Reid

quote: A good actor must never be in love with anyone but himself.
author: Jean Anouilh

quote: Every actor in his heart believes everything bad that's printed about him.
author: Orson Welles

quote: Actors are the only honest hypocrites.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Drama is life with the dull bits cut out.
author: Alfred Hitchcock

quote: Film-making has become a kind of hysterical pregnancy.
author: Richard Lester

quote: Not to go to the theatre is like making one's toilet without a mirror.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: You can't automate in the arts. Since the sixteenth century there has been no change in the number of people necessary to produce Hamlet.
author: William T. Wylie

quote: When actors begin to think  it is time for a change. They are not fitted for it.
author: Stephen Leacock

quote: Opening night is the night before the play is ready to open.
author: George Jean Nathan

quote: An actor is a sculptor who carves in snow.
author: Edwin Booth

quote: The unencumbered stage encourages the truth operative in everyone. The less seen  the more heard. The eye is the enemy of the ear in real drama.
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: The live entertainment Canadians like most is the intimate review  a collection of songs and sketches  preferably with a satirical bias.
author: Nathan Cohen

quote: Acting is happy agony.
author: Alec Guinness

quote: With the collapse of vaudeville new talent has no place to stink.
author: George Burns

quote: When the audience knows you know better  it's satire  but when they think you can't do any better  it's corn.
author: Spike Jones

quote: The person who wants to make it has to sweat. There are no short cuts. And you've got to have the guts to be hated.
author: Bene Davis

quote: True tragedy may be defined as a dramatic work in which the outward failure of the principal personage is compensated for by the dignity and greatness of his character.
author: Joseph Wood Krutch

quote: A fan club is a group of people who tell an actor he is not alone in the way he feels about himself.
author: Jack Carson

quote: The real actor - like any real artistj- has a direct line to the collective heart.
author: Bette Davis

quote: The best actors do not let the wheels show.
author: Henry Fonda

quote: A talent for drama is not a talent for writing  but is an ability to articulate human relationships.
author: Gore Vidal

quote: Many plays  certainly mine  are like blank cheques. The actors and directors put their own signatures on them.
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: You need three things in the theatre - the play  the actors and the audience and each must give something.
author: Kenneth Haigh

quote: From the point of view of the playwright  then  the essence of a tragedy  or even of a serious play  is the spiritual awakening  or regeneration  of his hero.
author: Maxwell Anderson

quote: Hamlet is the tragedy of tackling a family problem too soon after college.
author: Tom Mas son

quote: A film is never really good unless the camera is an eye in the head of a poet.
author: Orson Welles

quote: The whole motivation for any performer is 'Look at me  Ma.'
author: Lenny Bruce

quote: If you give audiences a chance they'll do half your acting for you.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quote: Show business is like sex. When it's wonderful  it's wonderful. But when it isn't very good  it's still all right.
author: Max Wall

quote: All the movies used to be 'colossal'. Now they're all 'frank'. I think I liked 'colossal' better.
author: Beryl Pfizer
